content: always include one mc round between each motif if you are working the ribbed cuff chart i recommend that you add the extra motifs after round 7 and then return to rounds 8-9 just before you work the ribbed cuff if you are working the rolled cuff chart i recommend that you add the extra motifs after round 16 and then return to rounds 17-19 just before you work the rolled cuff ribbed cuff rolled cuff round 1 all stitches worked in mc knit 1 m1lk using rounds 1-8 all stitches worked in mc knit the mc float knit until the bor you should have loosely bind off in pattern 52 56 60 64 68 72 76 80 stitches on your needles rounds 2-13 *knit 1 purl 2 knit 1* repeat until bor loosely bind off in pattern finishing to finish your turner gloves weave in all ends and wet block when soaking the gloves you may need to take precautions to avoid colour bleeding when drying make sure you pin the gloves to shape this will help to even out any waviness around your colourwork 8 @thestitchling pattern support email queries to thestitchlingdesigns@gmail com i will attempt to respond in a timely manner sharing please share your projects with the hashtags #turnergloves and #thestitchling and tag @thestitchling disclaimer please respect the time that i have invested in producing this pattern and the fact that this design is my intellectual property you may not reproduce any part of this pattern or commercially manufacture garments from it if you wish to handknit my pattern as a personal commission please only do so on a small scale never producing in excess of five garments 9
